page.title: 01GAZETTEER INFORMATION.
page.content: The area is mainly agricultural:a mixture of arable farming (cereal crops) and dairy farming, set in the Bourne Brook valley. It contains the villages of Drayton Bassett, Bonehill and parts of Fazely, Staffordshire, also a large leisure complex at Drayton Manor with golf course, fun fair, zoo. The area is traversed by the A5 Roman Watling Street E. to W., and A453 from Sutton Coldfield to Tamworth S.E. to N.W., and the Birmingham - Fazley canal on eastern perimeter. Along the A5 there are housing estates and some shops, and a large industrial works (Foseco) on the A4091, but much of the area is cultivated farmland, gently sloping, with isolated farms. The area around Bonehill is scheduled for future development. There is some building planned in Drayton Bassett village. Electricity pylons bisect area N. to S.
